protocol.name: P-GSE39010-2
protocol.text: Plants were grown single in pots that were either kept separate (single plants; control) or places in a 2066 plants / m2 dense canopy directly after transfer to these pots. 2 young petioles per plant were harvested in liquid N2 and petioles from 4 plants were pooled per biological replicate.

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-3
protocol.text: Arabidopsis thaliana plants were sown, stratified (4˚C) for 3 days and then transferred to a growth chamber (9 h. light (180 µmol / m2 / s, 20°C, 70% RH), 15 h dark) where they were transferred to individual pots after 10 d and grown until canopies reached a leaf area index = 0.9 (approx. 23 days after sowing).

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-4
protocol.text: Total RNA was isolated from homogenized material using the RNeasy plant mini kit (Qiagen) with on-column DNA digestion following the company’s instructions.

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-5
protocol.text: The Affymetrix 3'IVT-Express Labeling Kit was used to synthesize Biotin-labeled cRNA. From each RNA sample 100 ng was used as input for the labelling reactions.

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-6
protocol.text: The (#900720) GeneChip Hybridization, Wash and Stain Kit was used for hybridization, washing, staining and scanning of the chips.

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-7
protocol.text: The software program Affymetrix 'GeneChip Command Console (v3.1)' was used to operate the staning, washing and scanning of the GeneChips and visual inspection of the array images. Chips were scanned using the Affymetrix 3000G scanner.

protocol.name: P-GSE39010-8
protocol.text: Data were processed using the Bioconductor packages in R (version 2.15.0) and using the RMA normalization algorithm.
